meanings.definition: Lacking stylishness or neatness in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The old scarecrow looked even dowdier with its faded clothes.
meanings.sent2: Her dowdier outfit consisted of mismatched socks and a wrinkled shirt.
meanings.sent3: Despite her efforts, the princess ended up looking dowdier than the palace mice.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant garden now appeared dowdier under the gray sky.
meanings.sent5: The dusty attic was filled with dowdier furniture from a bygone era.

meanings.definition: Becoming less stylish or attractive over time.
meanings.sent1: The colors of the painting grew dowdier as the years passed.
meanings.sent2: The once elegant curtains now hung dowdier in the neglected room.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations started to look dowdier as the night wore on.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project faded, leaving her ideas dowdier than before.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant city square slowly turned dowdier with each passing season.
